meanings.definition: An instance of something becoming popular, active, or important again.
meanings.sent1: The old song experienced a sudden revival in popularity.
meanings.sent2: The revival of interest in vintage fashion is evident in the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: The revival of the classic movie brought joy to many fans.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting had a revival after attending an art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The revival of the town's economy brought hope to its residents.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something back to life, consciousness, or activity.
meanings.sent1: CPR is a life-saving technique that can lead to the revival of a person.
meanings.sent2: The revival of the patient's heartbeat was a relief to the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The revival of the computer system after the crash surprised everyone in the office.
meanings.sent4: The revival of the plant after watering it made the gardener happy.
meanings.sent5: The revival of the old car engine required some expert tinkering.

meanings.definition: A series of religious meetings or services held to inspire and renew faith.
meanings.sent1: The church organized a revival to bring the community together in faith.
meanings.sent2: Attending the revival helped strengthen her belief in the power of prayer.
meanings.sent3: The revival at the church was so uplifting that even the skeptics felt moved.
meanings.sent4: The revival preacher's words sparked a spiritual revival in the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The revival choir's harmonious voices filled the sanctuary with joy.
